intro: Drejera boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian dragon tree, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, spiky, red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a woody stem with a distinctive, branching structure, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate in shape. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, dry conditions of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
